JobFullDesc: Join us as we take Microsoft Teams, SharePoint, and OneDrive, our fast-growing collaboration and productivity products to the next level. We are looking for passionate product leaders to define and deliver new ways to help people connect, organize, and collaborate across work, school, and home.  The team has multiple positions available that provide the opportunity to deliver key advancements for our customers to help them achieve more together. You will be responsible for capturing customer needs, coordinating product plans, building roadmaps, designing features, and delivering them to unlock new capabilities. These roles are a mix of product thinking, user-centric design, technical horsepower, business analysis, cross-team collaboration, and external customer engagement. These positions provide opportunities from creative to deeply technical and all will enable you to redefine how people work and collaborate.  What’s it like to work on Microsoft Teams, SharePoint, and OneDrive? Well, we thrive in a fast-moving environment that lets us quickly explore, iterate, and deliver value to our customers. We leverage frequent opportunities to engage directly with executives and customers to review our ideas and work. Our colleagues are among the best in the industry and share an intense passion for delivering amazing products. We’re also a team that likes to have fun and continually learn, and we build that attitude into how we work together and what we create.  We are deeply committed to diversity and inclusion. We believe that the best software comes from diverse, inclusive teams that celebrate the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and skills of all team members. The more we come together, the more we will achieve. ResponsibilitiesPartner across Microsoft to understand business goals, user needs, collect requirements, and synthesize product plans to deliver maximum impact across all areas. Deliver end-to-end product solutions, including competitive research, requirements definition, user experience, and delivery of capabilities. Successfully validate and improve product solutions over time through measurement and experimentation. Manage dependencies across teams to ensure that features land on time with the required scope across desktop, mobile and web. Engage with customers and internal preview users, and triage, prioritize, and address customer feedback for your area. Regularly present new product plans, strategy, demos, competitive reviews, and more to the leadership team. QualificationsRequired Qualifications5+ years of program/product management experience Proven track record and experience in defining and shipping enterprise software preferably in the real time communications, collaboration, chat and messaging space.Preferred QualificationsBachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience. Exceptional technical aptitude and customer empath Exceptional analytical andproblem solving abilities Experience in project management, including planning, execution, estimation, risk management, and stakeholder management. Strong ability to handle ambiguity and rapid change Demonstrated collaboration skills that require influencing peers and leaders to embrace best practices and align to engineering goals Strong verbal/written communication skills By applying to this position, you are being considered for multiple like positions within - OneDrive/SharePoint & TEAMS Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.
